definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: It's good we checked the time of the train.
sentences.chinese: 还好，我们核查了火车时刻。

sentences.english: This sort of meta-programming style does not lend itself to static type checking.
sentences.chinese: 这种元程序风格很难进行静态类型核查。

sentences.english: Verifying the comprehensiveness and timeliness of the data in foreign-related revenue and expenditure declaration.
sentences.chinese: 核查涉外收支申报数据全面性和及时性。

sentences.english: Receive alarm hind, prefectural public security bureau and department of propaganda of county Party committee undertook checking instantly.
sentences.chinese: 接警后，县公安局与县委宣传部立即进行了核查。

sentences.english: Many employers also check whether potential hires can speak Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 许多用人单位也会核查应聘者是否会讲普通话。
执行一些欺诈核查分析。

sentences.english: China is now studying in a serious manner the proposal of negotiating a FMCT without verification.
sentences.chinese: 中方正在认真研究谈判无核查“禁产条约”的建议。

sentences.english: I have had a background check done by security and have been found to be a Safe Person.
sentences.chinese: 安检部门对我的背景来历核查过，认定我为人可靠。

sentences.english: Okay, I'll check the signature of the guest in room 3307.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我将核查一下3307房间客人的签字。

sentences.english: would not have checked the provenance of that story?
sentences.chinese: 没有核查那个故事的出处。

sentences.english: The reporter interviewed the old man and checked out his family history.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者采访了那位老人，核查了他的家史。

sentences.english: Ultimately we found there was much truth in what he was presenting.
sentences.chinese: 在他展示的证据中核查人员还能找出更多的实情。

sentences.english: A visiting committee also checked on the claimant to guard against false claims.
sentences.chinese: 一个访查委员会负责核查申领人以防止虚假申领。

sentences.english: Checking the sum of people on the farm I called the roll under the palm.
sentences.chinese: 我核查农场的人总共多少号，在棕榈树下按名册叫。

sentences.english: And no one usually checks whether people entering a traditional marrige already have spouses.
sentences.chinese: 并且没有人会核查结婚的人是否已经有配偶。

sentences.english: The verification has identified material misstatements in the reported emission reductions.
sentences.chinese: 核查对报告的减排发现实质性的误差。

definition: to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to investigate and find out/to ascertain
to screen/to discriminate/to reexamine a case/screening (of applicants etc)
